main event: A bright, flashing light was observed in the southeastern sky near Cato, New York, during the early morning hours of 31 September 1962.
interesting points: The object was confirmed by Air Traffic Control Radar., It was reported that the light was partly obscured by clouds., The observer noted a 5-minute duration of the sighting., The course of the object was approximately 265 degrees., There was a suggestion in the report that the object could have been a satellite.
witness description: The report does not provide detailed descriptions of the witness.
